Package image

Class Image

  • java.lang.Object
    • image.Image
  • public class Image
extends java.lang.Object
    Class representing an image.
    Author:
    Ã‰rick Oliveira Rodrigues (erickr@id.uff.br)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Image​(byte[][] img)
      Creates a new image that is 8-bits depth (from 0 to 255) with the values of the matrix img
      Image​(int[][] img)
      Assumes the image is grey and the image values are at most 32 bits depth and creates a new image based on the values of matrix img.
      Image​(int width, int height)
      Instantiates a new 8-bits depth grey image
      Image​(int width, int height, int numBands)
      Creates a 8-bits depth image
      Image​(int width, int height, int numBands, int bitDepth)  
      Image​(int width, int height, int numBands, int bitDepth, boolean canAssumeFloatValues)  
      Image​(short[][] img)
      Creates a new image that is 16-bits depth with the values of the matrix img
      Image​(Image img)
      Clones a image of type Image, creates a new object that is identical to the previous image but is a different object
      Image​(java.awt.image.BufferedImage img)
      If the image is RGB-layered it will be converted to one single layer as the mean of every layer.
      Image​(java.io.File imgFile)  
      Image​(java.lang.String imagePath)

      • contrast

        public Image contrast()
        Contrast the image according to a 8-bit depth image (from 0 to 255). In other words, stretches the image values to within this range: [0,255].
        Throws:
        java.lang.CloneNotSupportedException

      • normalize

        public Image normalize​(double newMinimum,
                       double newMaximum)
        Linearly convert the image values to a new range. If your images goes from -10 to 80, and your pass as parameter newMinimum = 0 and newMaximum = 255, your image is stretched out to fir the range [0,255], for instance.
        Parameters:
        newMinimum -
        newMaximum -

      • stretchOrShrinkRange

        Parameters:
        newMinimum -
        newMaximum -

        public void setBoundaryOperation​(Image.BoundaryOperationType boundaryOperation)
        Sets the boundary operation.
        Parameters:
        boundaryOperation - - Image#BOUNDARY_MODULE if we want to take the module of the coordinate in respect to the size of the image, or Image#BOUNDARY_REFLECT if we want to take the reflect the pixels near the boundary.

        public boolean equals​(Image comparedImg)
               throws java.lang.Exception

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • compare

        public double compare​(Image comparedImg,
                      SimilarityMeasure sm)
               throws java.lang.Exception
        Compares this image with an imaged passed as parameter according to a certain similarity measure, returns a double value representing the similarity. The correspondence of the value depends on the employed measure, but usually, the lower the returned result the better.
        Parameters:
        comparedImg -
        sm -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

        Transforms this image in a subimage, starting at position (x, y), with width and height as set in the parameters.
        Parameters:
        x -
        y -
        width -
        height -
        Returns:

      • dilate

        public Image dilate​(Image structuringElement,
                    int times,
                    boolean contrast)
        Dilates the image based on the structuring element passed as parameter. You can create a new structuring element or use one of the Morphology class (Morphology). E.g., Morphology.PRIMARY_STRUCT for grey images, Morphology.SIMPLE_BINARY_RECT for binary images, etc. If the desired dilation is a binary dilation, do not forget to convert the image to binary first. Otherwise that could introduce problems related to the upper and lower limits of the image.
        Parameters:
        structuringElement - - the structuring element
        times - - how many times the dilation will be performed
        contrast - - whether or not to contrast the image (if not enabled, the image may very easily exceed the 255 value (max of 8bits depth images)
        Returns:
        - the dilated image
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • dilate

        public Image dilate​(Image structuringElement,
                    int times)
        Dilates the image based on the structuring element passed as parameter. You can create a new structuring element or use one of the Morphology class (Morphology). E.g., Morphology.PRIMARY_STRUCT for grey images, Morphology.SIMPLE_BINARY_RECT for binary images, etc. If the desired dilation is a binary dilation, do not forget to convert the image to binary first. Otherwise that could introduce problems related to the upper and lower limits of the image.
        Parameters:
        structuringElement - - the structuring element
        times - - how many times the dilation will be performed
        Returns:
        - the dilated image
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • erode

        public Image erode​(Image structuringElement,
                   int times)
        Erodes the image based on the structuring element passed as parameter. You can create a new structuring element or use one of the Morphology class (Morphology). . E.g., Morphology.PRIMARY_STRUCT for grey images, Morphology.SIMPLE_BINARY_RECT for binary images, etc. If the desired dilation is a binary dilation, do not forget to convert the image to binary first. Otherwise that could introduce problems related to the upper and lower limits of the image.
        Parameters:
        structuringElement - - the structuring element
        times - - how many times the dilation will be performed
        Returns:
        - the dilated image
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • erode

        public Image erode​(Image structuringElement,
                   int times,
                   boolean contrast)
        Erodes the image based on the structuring element passed as parameter. You can create a new structuring element or use one of the Morphology class (Morphology). E.g., Morphology.PRIMARY_STRUCT for grey images, Morphology.SIMPLE_BINARY_RECT for binary images, etc. If the desired dilation is a binary dilation, do not forget to convert the image to binary first. Otherwise that could introduce problems related to the upper and lower limits of the image.
        Parameters:
        structuringElement - - the structuring element
        times - - how many times the dilation will be performed
        contrast - - whether or not to contrast the image (if not enabled, the image may very easily exceed the 255 value (max of 8bits depth images)
        Returns:
        - the dilated image
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
